Key Match Events: Vangelis Pavlidis scored a double to condemn England to a 2-1 UEFA Nations League defeat to Greece at Wembley.
Jude Bellingham lashed in an equaliser with three minutes of normal time remaining.
Vangelis Pavlidis slammed home his second of the game after scrappy defending in the England penalty area in the 94th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: England set up with what appeared to be an ultra-attacking XI against Greece on Thursday night at Wembley, but it was the visitors who possessed the greater thrust during most of the evening.
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley’s team – who were second best throughout – got what they deserved for slack play at the back.
Carsley tried to give the England fans what they wanted, but by crowbarring in Gordon, Saka, Foden, Palmer and Bellingham, it was a case of too many chefs spoiling the broth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result marks England’s first competitive loss at Wembley in four years, and their first ever defeat to Greece.
Carsley took a knock in the third match of his interim tenure.
Others: Andres Iniesta on his retirement and what's next - 'I would have played until 90 if it was possible'
